intro: Guidonia vareca, commonly known as the Italian broom, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, three-lobed leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Guidonia vareca is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it a valuable plant in ecological restoration projects.
